TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}

S.FORM: pai patsuni tu aitsu imaza itua kai nua Tsemas.
pai paconi to aico imaza itoa kai noa Cemas.
S.TRANSL: Let us look at this passage here in the word of God.

S.FORM: aitsu a vetsik imaza, kiłivaku tua nu łaqediqedi, aya.
aico a vecik imaza, kiljivako toa no ljaqediqedi, aya.
S.TRANSL: This writing here says Love your neighbours.

S.FORM: pai izua zua maqatsuvutsuvung vaik a sema zua i tjai Yisu-sama.
pai izoa zoa maqacovocovong vaik a sema zoa i tjai Yiso-sama.
S.TRANSL: Now there was a young person who went to Jesus.

S.FORM: "tima mana ku łaqediqedi?" aya kivadaq timadju.
"tima mana ko ljaqediqedi?" aya kivadaq timadjo.
S.TRANSL: “Who is my neighbour?” he asked.

S.FORM: manu tevelain ni Yisu-sama: "pai ku su pasemalavay.
mano tevelain ni Yiso-sama: "pai ko so pasemalavay.
S.TRANSL: And Jesus replied: “I will tell you.

S.FORM: izua zua matsidił a nakemasi zua i Yirusałim a pasa Yiriku a patjełelauz.
izoa zoa macidilj a nakemasi zoa i Yirosaljim a pasa Yiriko a patjeljelaoz.
S.TRANSL: There was a person who went down from Jerusalem towards Jericho.

S.FORM: manu setsevung tua za tsaḍ.
mano secevong toa za cadr.
S.TRANSL: And he met some robbers.

S.FORM: qau azua tsaḍ kirimuin a djemukul timadju, sa uri papatsayi, sa sukava-i timadju, sa paseqerengi, sa alapi aza nanemanemanga, sa vaikan.
qao azoa cadr kirimoin a djemokol timadjo, sa ori papacayi, sa sokava-i timadjo, sa paseqerengi, sa alapi aza nanemanemanga, sa vaikan.
S.TRANSL: And the robbers quickly beat him up, and were going to kill him, and took off his clothes and knocked him over and took everything, and left him.

S.FORM: qau pai ka naseqereng anga azua matsidił, tsemalivat azua kisamułamuła i tsakar.
qao pai ka naseqereng anga azoa macidilj, cemalivat azoa kisamoljamolja i cakar.
S.TRANSL: And as the man was lying there, a person who worked hard at the shrine passed by.

S.FORM: manu inika pinatsunan.
mano inika pinaconan.
S.TRANSL: He didn’t look at him;

S.FORM: vaik sakamaya timadju a lemagaw a pasulivay tsemalivat.
vaik sakamaya timadjo a lemagaw a pasolivay cemalivat.
S.TRANSL: he just made a detour and ignored him and passed on.

S.FORM: mangtjez uta a se Łibi a tsautsau; manu patsunan aza naseqereng.
mangtjez ota a se Ljibi a caocao; mano paconan aza naseqereng.
S.TRANSL: A person from Levi also came. He looked at the person lying there,

S.FORM: lagavan uta nimadju, sa vaik.
lagavan ota nimadjo, sa vaik.
S.TRANSL: and also made a detour and went.

S.FORM: mangtjez anga a sika masan tjeluł a se Samalia a nanguaq aravats a tsautsau.
mangtjez anga a sika masan tjelolj a se Samalia a nangoaq aravac a caocao.
S.TRANSL: The third person to come was a very good person from Samaria.

S.FORM: łeteku anga timadju taza kinavavavan a lakuda, sa sazua-i anga patsun aza naseqereng, sa alapan anga tua tsemel nimadju, sa putsemeli, sa tsavu-i anga aza mareka piqay.
ljeteko anga timadjo taza kinavavavan a lakoda, sa sazoa-i anga pacon aza naseqereng, sa alapan anga toa cemel nimadjo, sa pocemeli, sa cavo-i anga aza mareka piqay.
S.TRANSL: He got down from the camel he was riding, and went and looked at the person lying there, and got out his medicines and applied them to him, and bandaged the wounds.

S.FORM: pai sa tsatsułu-i anga a pasa vavaw tua lakuda nimadju, sa vaikan anga pasa kakasiułayan.
pai sa cacoljo-i anga a pasa vavaw toa lakoda nimadjo, sa vaikan anga pasa kakasioljayan.
S.TRANSL: Then he put him on his camel, and went off with him to the inn.

S.FORM: qau pai ka izua i kakasiułayan, 'uza a paisu manu uri sikasiułay nusa tiza.
qao pai ka izoa i kakasioljayan, 'oza a paiso mano ori sikasioljay nosa tiza.
S.TRANSL: And when he was there at the inn the person from Samaria said (to them): ‘Here is some money to pay for this person’s stay.

S.FORM: nu inika kamseng, ku vayi anga uta nutiaw,' ayain nua zua se Samalia a tsautsau.
no inika kamseng, ko vayi anga ota notiaw,' ayain noa zoa se Samalia a caocao.
S.TRANSL: If it isn’t enough, I’ll give more tomorrow.’

S.FORM: qau pai tisun," ayatutsuin ni Yisu-sama aza maqatsuvutsuvung, "manu inu mana nakiłivak tua łaqediqedi?" ayain.
qao pai tison," ayatocoin ni Yiso-sama aza maqacovocovong, "mano ino mana nakiljivak toa ljaqediqedi?" ayain.
S.TRANSL: “Now as for you,” said Jesus to the young person, “which one loved his neighbour?” he said.

S.FORM: "mavan aza sika masan tjeluł mana nakiłivak tua łaqediqedi a napaseqełing," aya a temvela.
"mavan aza sika masan tjelolj mana nakiljivak toa ljaqediqedi a napaseqeljing," aya a temvela.
S.TRANSL: “It was the third one, who showed love to his neighbour and saved him,” he replied.

S.FORM: "qau pai tisun sa-u aitaza-u uta, kiłivaku tua su łaqediqedi," ayain anga ni Yisu-sama.
"qao pai tison sa-o aitaza-o ota, kiljivako toa so ljaqediqedi," ayain anga ni Yiso-sama.
S.TRANSL: “Well you go and do the same; love your neighbours,”Jesus said to him.

S.FORM: pai aitsu nu kinemnem itjen a mapułat, aitsu a łaqediqedi nu aya, aitsu a ti Yisu, inika manu amin a kipalinguł tua tja umaq, inika amin a mareka tja qali a mareka tja kaka nu siayaya.
pai aico no kinemnem itjen a mapoljat, aico a ljaqediqedi no aya, aico a ti Yiso, inika mano amin a kipalingolj toa tja omaq, inika amin a mareka tja qali a mareka tja kaka no siayaya.
S.TRANSL: Now when we all think about this, when we say neighbour, as for Jesus, it means not only those living round our house, not only our friends or our siblings.

S.FORM: aitsu a imaza i katsauan a mapułat, a senema a senema, nuka tsadja aravats, tjara tja łaqediqedi a mapułat.
aico a imaza i kacaoan a mapoljat, a senema a senema, noka cadja aravac, tjara tja ljaqediqedi a mapoljat.
S.TRANSL: All the people here in the world, from here or there, even those a long way off, they are certainly all our neighbours.

S.FORM: saka titjen a mapułat, aitsu imaza i katsauan a mapułat nia łaqediqedi, aya-i a mapułat.
saka titjen a mapoljat, aico imaza i kacaoan a mapoljat nia ljaqediqedi, aya-i a mapoljat.
S.TRANSL: So all of us let us all recognise that all the people in the world are our neighbours.

S.FORM: nu setsevung itjen tua selapalapay, nu setsevung itjen tua qemauqaung, nu setsevung itjen tua nasemalimsim, tja paseqełingaw tja tjiakaw tja pakavałutaw.
no secevong itjen toa selapalapay, no secevong itjen toa qemaoqaong, no secevong itjen toa nasemalimsim, tja paseqeljingaw tja tjiakaw tja pakavaljotaw.
S.TRANSL: If we meet those who are suffering, if we meet those who are crying, if we meet those who are in trouble, let us save, lead and help them.

S.FORM: aitsu a ini anan ka sekełang tua kai nua Tsemas, tja tjiakaw a pasa tjaiqayaw tjai Yisu-sama, uła namapaseqełing tiamadju.
aico a ini anan ka sekeljang toa kai noa Cemas, tja tjiakaw a pasa tjaiqayaw tjai Yiso-sama, olja namapaseqeljing tiamadjo.
S.TRANSL: Let us lead to Jesus those who do not yet know the word of God, so that they may be saved.

S.FORM: nu namayatutsu itjen mana uri napasusu itjen tua kai ni Yisu-sama.
no namayatoco itjen mana ori napasoso itjen toa kai ni Yiso-sama.
S.TRANSL: If we do this we will fulfil the words of Jesus.

S.FORM: kiłivaku tua su łaqediqedi, aya tjanuitjen a mapułat.
kiljivako toa so ljaqediqedi, aya tjanoitjen a mapoljat.
S.TRANSL: Love your neighbours, he says to us all.

S.FORM: amin.
amin.
S.TRANSL: The end.

S.FORM: pai anema nia sitjumał tjanusun a naqemati a Tsemas, tjanusun a ti Yisu-sama?
pai anema nia sitjomalj tjanoson a naqemati a Cemas, tjanoson a ti Yiso-sama?
S.TRANSL: What are we to say to you, Creator God, to you, Jesus?

S.FORM: małimałi aravats a su zukerin anga men a imaza i katsalisian, sa su kana paseqełiqełing anga tjanuamen.
maljimalji aravac a so zokerin anga men a imaza i kacalisian, sa so kana paseqeljiqeljing anga tjanoamen.
S.TRANSL: Thank you very much for your reaching us here the people of the mountains and saving us.

S.FORM: anemanan nia sitjumał tjanusun a ti Yisu-sama?
anemanan nia sitjomalj tjanoson a ti Yiso-sama?
S.TRANSL: And what are we to say to you, Jesus?

S.FORM: pai aitsu a nasepasalisaliw a tiamen su ruram-en amen sa su pakełangi amen ta uri nia pakazuanan.
pai aico a nasepasalisaliw a tiamen so roram-en amen sa so pakeljangi amen ta ori nia pakazoanan.
S.TRANSL: You have come to(?) us who had sinned, and you have taught us the way we should go.

S.FORM: anema nia sitjumał?
anema nia sitjomalj?
S.TRANSL: What are we to say?

S.FORM: pai, Yisu-sama, aitsu a mareka imaza i gadu a mareka tja kaka a katsalisian a namavilivilił a namavavutuvutu a sitsuayan, pai aitsu su łaluayi anga men sa su tjautsikeli anga men ta uri nia sikatsaquan a maqaqełiqełing a mareka kaka.

pai, Yiso-sama, aico a mareka imaza i gado a mareka tja kaka a kacalisian a namavilivililj a namavavotovoto a sicoayan, pai aico so ljaloayi anga men sa so tjaocikeli anga men ta ori nia sikacaqoan a maqaqeljiqeljing a mareka kaka.
S.TRANSL: We and our brothers and sisters here in the mountains, mountain people who were uncivilised and at enmity with one another in times past, you have made it clear to us and have told us how we should be able to help one another as brothers and sisters.

S.FORM: saka pai aitsu nuka men a matsadjatsadja, nuka namaqaqetsiqetsi a nia matjałałak, uła nia vetjek anga a mapułat.
saka pai aico noka men a macadjacadja, noka namaqaqeciqeci a nia matjaljaljak, olja nia vetjek anga a mapoljat.
S.TRANSL: And so even though our parents lived far apart and fought one another, they are all to be our brothers and sisters.

S.FORM: nu nakisusu anga men, nu napasusu anga men ta su pazazekazekatj, uła men a natjemiatjiak anga sema tjaiqayaw sakamaya tjanusun.
no nakisoso anga men, no napasoso anga men ta so pazazekazekatj, olja men a natjemiatjiak anga sema tjaiqayaw sakamaya tjanoson.
S.TRANSL: When we have become followers and fulfil your commands, may we lead them all to you.

S.FORM: pai uła men a pitjakemłamłang anga, uła men a nakikakezeng anga sakamaya tjanusun.
pai olja men a pitjakemljamljang anga, olja men a nakikakezeng anga sakamaya tjanoson.
S.TRANSL: May we understand better, may we stand firm in reliance on you alone.

S.FORM: tisun a naqemati a Tsemas, naqemati a Tsemas a nakiłivak tjanuamen a napasa maza i katsauan, uła men a nayayanga sakamaya; saka mareka vetjevetjek itjen, uła men a naya.
tison a naqemati a Cemas, naqemati a Cemas a nakiljivak tjanoamen a napasa maza i kacaoan, olja men a nayayanga sakamaya; saka mareka vetjevetjek itjen, olja men a naya.
S.TRANSL: You are the creator God, the creator God who loved us and came here to the world, is what we should say; and we should say that we are all brothers and sisters;

S.FORM: uła ika men a nasemanvilił.
olja ika men a nasemanvililj.
S.TRANSL: so that we don’t hate anyone,

S.FORM: kumałi a na nia vutu, uła nia tjiaken sakamaya.
komalji a na nia voto, olja nia tjiaken sakamaya.
S.TRANSL: even those who were our enemies, and so that we only lead them on.

S.FORM: ayatutsu-i, uła tjen a sema tjaiqayaw tjai Yisu-sama uła namapaseqełing.
ayatoco-i, olja tjen a sema tjaiqayaw tjai Yiso-sama olja namapaseqeljing.
S.TRANSL: Let us say this, so that we may come to Jesus so that we may be saved;

S.FORM: uła vaik a semusu tua sinan djalan ni Yisu-sama a tja tamasi, uła men a nayanga sakamaya marepaqaqełiqełing, nu izua uri matsay i kadjalanan, nu izua matsułatsuła, aya ti Yisu-sama tazua tulu tjanuitjen.

olja vaik a semoso toa sinan djalan ni Yiso-sama a tja tamasi, olja men a nayanga sakamaya marepaqaqeljiqeljing, no izoa ori macay i kadjalanan, no izoa macoljacolja, aya ti Yiso-sama tazoa tolo tjanoitjen.
S.TRANSL: so that our souls may follow the way opened by Jesus, let us say and help one another. If there is someone dying at the roadside, if are there people hungry, says Jesus in his teaching for us,

S.FORM: parepaseqełiqełingi, uła men a nayanga sakamaya nakikakezeng sakamaya ta su pazazekazekatj.
parepaseqeljiqeljingi, olja men a nayanga sakamaya nakikakezeng sakamaya ta so pazazekazekatj.
S.TRANSL: let us help one another, let us say, just relying on your commands.

S.FORM: ?aming.
?aming.
S.TRANSL: Amen.

S.FORM: pai tisun a nia Tsemas a ti Yisu-sama, małimałi aravats su kinizangan amen tusa nia sinukuban i tjaiqayaw tjanusun.
pai tison a nia Cemas a ti Yiso-sama, maljimalji aravac so kinizangan amen tosa nia sinokoban i tjaiqayaw tjanoson.
S.TRANSL: Jesus our God, thank you very much for guarding us during our time of worship before you.

S.FORM: pai a su pitsul a su garang a su kiłivak a su valisakedan a su rupazekatjan uła su sinipakizangan tjanuamen a mapułat, a marevetjevetjek i Igiris, a tiamen a imaza i Tayuang a selizuk a katsalisian a mapułat.

pai a so picol a so garang a so kiljivak a so valisakedan a so ropazekatjan olja so sinipakizangan tjanoamen a mapoljat, a marevetjevetjek i Igiris, a tiamen a imaza i Tayoang a selizok a kacalisian a mapoljat.
S.TRANSL: May your power, might, love, concern and forgiveness protect us all, our brothers and sisters in England and us here in Taiwan, all the plainspeople and mountain people.

S.FORM: aitsu a nia kiqaung nia pinaka tjanusun a ti Yisu-sama.
aico a nia kiqaong nia pinaka tjanoson a ti Yiso-sama.
S.TRANSL: We make our prayer through you, Jesus.
qaming
